sentence.text: Mutations in the gene encoding the single transmembrane receptor multiple epidermal growth factor-like domain 10 (homotypic cell-cell adhesion) cause an autosomal recessive congenital muscle disease in humans.

Although mammalian homotypic cell-cell adhesion is expressed in the central nervous system as well as in skeletal muscle, patients carrying mutations in MEGF10 do not show symptoms of central nervous system dysfunction.

The histological and behavioral abnormalities seen in the affected flies negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated the stage for further studies examining the signaling pathway modulated by homotypic cell-cell adhesion/Drpr in muscle, as well as assessing the effects of genetic and/or pharmacological manipulations on the observed muscle defects.
